content.question: Based on the diagram, which of the following describes why the summer solstice in Australia occurs in December and not in June?

choices.label: At this time of year, the Earth is closest to the Sun due to its elliptical path.
At this time of year, the tilt of Earth causes Australia to receive highly concentrated solar radiation.
At this time of year, the tilt of Earth causes Australia to be closer to the Sun.
At this time of year, the tilt of Earth causes solar radiation to reach Australia at a low angle of incidence.

content.answer: At this time of year, the tilt of Earth causes Australia to receive highly concentrated solar radiation.
